bibl.title: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench to Jefferson Randolph Kean

div1.p: Hench has notified Truman's physician, the Lazears' children, Moran, and Kellogg, about Emilie L. Reed's death. It is impossible for him to attend her funeral.

div1.head: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench to Jefferson Randolph Kean, July 23, 1950
div1.opener:
WESTERN
UNION
W. P. MARSHALL, PRESIDENT
1206
Send the following message, subject to the terms on back hereof, which are hereby agreed to
GENERAL JEFFERSON R KEAN 2804 N ST NW GEORGETOWN WASHINGTON DC
div1.p:
HAVE WIRED TRUMAN'S PHYSICIAN, ALSO LAZEAR,S CHILDREN, MORAN AND
GEORGE KELLOGG ABOUT MRS REED,S DEATH. ASSUME WALTER REED MEMORIAL
ASSOCIATION SENDING FLOWERS AND REPRESENTATIVES TO FUNERAL TUESDAY.
WISH I COULD COME BUT IMPOSSIBLE AS TWO DEPARTMENTAL ASSOCIATES AWAY
div1.closer:
DR PHILIP S HENCH COPY OF NL SEND JULY 23RD
C
